title: Gold Was Our Grave
text:
Gold Was Our Grave is a 1954 <a href="mystery%20novel">mystery</a> <a href="detective%20novel">detective novel</a> by the British writer <a href="Sir%20Henry%20Aubrey-Fletcher%2C%206th%20Baronet">Henry Wade</a>. It was the seventh and last in a series of novels featuring the character of <a href="Inspector">Inspector</a> Poole, published during the <a href="Golden%20Age%20of%20Detective%20Fiction">Golden Age of Detective Fiction</a>.
Synopsis.
After Hector Berrenton narrowly survives a car accident, he returns home to find a threatening note. It seems likely that someone has tampered with his car, seeking revenge for his involvement in a <a href="Bolivia">Bolivia</a>n <a href="gold%20mine">goldmining</a> concern that left many investors ruined several years earlier.
